passage_text: Confidence votes 45.1K. Three band members died in the crash: lead singer Ronnie Van Zant, Cassie Gaines, and her brother Steve Gaines. Lynyrd Skynyrd is not a real person. Lynyrd Skynyrd is just the name of the band; none of the band members are named Lynyrd Skynyrd. See the Related Question below for more information.
Johnny Van Zant is the brother of Ronnie Van Zant (the original Lynyrd Skynyrd singer) & Donnie Van Zant (guitarist & singer of The .38 Special Band).

Perhaps inevitably, the band reunited in 1987, with Gary Rossington, Billy Powell, Leon Wilkeson, Artimus Pyle and guitarist Ed King — who had left the band two years before the crash — joined by Ronnie Van Zant’s younger brother Johnny as their new lead singer.

Three band members died in the crash: lead singer Ronnie Van Zant, Cassie Gaines, and her brother Steve Gaines. Lynyrd Skynyrd is not a real person. Lynyrd Skynyrd is just the name of the band; none of the band members are named Lynyrd Skynyrd. See the Related Question below for more information.

READ THIS! This song is about Johnny Van Zant's older brother Ronnie, who died in a plane crash in 1977. Ronnie was the lead singer of Lynyrd Skynyrd; Johnny took over after his death. SOME FACTS: The three of us walking down that road refers to the Van Zant brothers (Johnny, Ronnie, Donnie).

Skynyrd singer Ronnie Van Zant, guitarist Steve Gaines, vocalist Cassie Gaines, assistant road manager Dean Kilpatrick, pilot Walter McCreary and co-pilot William Gray were killed instantly, while the other band members and road crew suffered terrible injuries.
